net.kuujo.copycat.raft.server

Class Commit<T extends Operation>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.kuujo.copycat.raft.server.Commit<T>

  • public class Commit<T extends Operation>
extends Object
    Represents the committed state and metadata of a Raft state machine operation.

    This class is used by the RaftServer internally to expose committed commands and queries to the user provided StateMachine. Operations that are wrapped in a Commit object are guaranteed to be persisted in the Raft log on a majority of the cluster. The commit object provides metadata about the committed operation such as the index() at which the operation was written in the log, the timestamp() at which it was written, and the Session that submitted the operation.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • index

        public long index()
        Returns the commit index.

        This is the index at which the committed Operation was written in the Raft log. Copycat guarantees that this index will be the same for all instances of the given operation on all nodes in the cluster.

        Note that for Query operations, the returned index may actually represent the last committed index in the Raft log since queries are not actually written to disk. This, however, does not break the single index guarantee since queries will only be applied to the leader's StateMachine.

        Returns:
        The commit index.

      • session

        public Session session()
        Returns the session that submitted the operation.

        The returned Session is representative of the session that submitted the operation that resulted in this Commit. Note that the session will be provided regardless of whether the session is currently active in the cluster. However, attempts to Session.publish(Object) to inactive sessions will fail silently.

        Additionally, because clients only connect to one server at any given time, the Session provided in any given commit to any StateMachine may or may not be capable of communicating with the client.

        Returns:
        The session that created the commit.

      • timestamp

        public long timestamp()
        Returns the commit timestamp.

        The timestamp is representative of the time at which the leader wrote the operation to its log. Because commit timestamps are replicated through the Raft consensus algorithm, they are guaranteed to be consistent across all servers and therefore can be used to perform time-dependent operations such as expiring keys or timeouts.

        Users should never use System time to control behavior in a state machine and should instead rely upon Commit timestamps for time-based controls.

        Returns:
        the commit timestamp.

      • type

        public Class<T> type()
        Returns the commit type.

        This is the Class returned by the committed operation's Object.getClass() method.

        Returns:
        The commit type.

      • operation

        public T operation()
        Returns the operation submitted by the user.

        The returned Operation is the operation submitted by the user via Raft.submit(net.kuujo.copycat.raft.Operation).

        Returns:
        The operation submitted by the user.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
